Items.Title: Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabba Sara Hurwitz, Co-founder and Dean of Yeshivat Maharat, 3700 Henry Hudson Parkway, Bronx, N.Y. 10463.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cohen.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabba Sara Hurwitz, Co-founder and Dean of Yeshivat Maharat, 3700 Henry Hudson Parkway, Bronx, N.Y. 10463.

Council Member Cohen moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 16, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Deutsch.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Deutsch moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 16, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor – Submitting the name of Carlo Silvestri to the City Council for advice and consent concerning his appointment to the New York City Tax Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 153 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Carlo Silvestri, New York City Tax Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Submitting the name of Debra Scotto to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the Environmental Control Board, pursuant to Sections 31 and 1049-a of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Debra Scotto, Environmental Control Board

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 151 Elizabeth Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 1, Application No. 20175260 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 151 Elizabeth Street, Manhattan (20175260 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Contracts

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the contract award threshold requiring a vendor doing business with the city to complete a VENDEX questionnaire
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the contract award threshold requiring a vendor doing business with the city to complete a VENDEX questionnaire.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring contractors and subcontractors to submit information to VENDEX electronically
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring contractors and subcontractors to submit information to VENDEX electronically.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring information about city contracts and contractors to be available online for public access
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring information about city contracts and contractors to be available online for public access.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Education

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding distribution of college savings plan materials in schools to include pre-kindergarten and to distributing college savings plan materials to parents or guardians within three months after a child’s date of birth
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expanding college savings plan materials in schools to include pre-kindergarten and to distributing college savings plan materials to parents or guardians with a child’s certificate of registration of birth.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 3231, Lot 1) Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 605).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 605 - Bushwick Cedar Apartments, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 386, Lot 1) Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 606).

Items.MatterName: LU 606 - 37 Avenue B HDFC, Manhattan

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: OSHA notification act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting and providing information concerning bedbugs
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reporting and providing information concerning bedbugs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring cranes to be equipped with global positioning systems or similar locating devices
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Requiring cranes to be equipped with global positioning systems or similar locating devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to report on all construction incidents that result in an injury or fatality to a member of the public or a construction worker
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Requiring DOB to report on all construction incidents that result in an injury or fatality to a member of the public or a construction worker.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to maintaining crane event records
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Maintaining crane event records.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing for operators of certain complex cranes
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Licensing for operators of certain complex cranes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring construction superintendents at certain construction sites
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Requiring construction superintendents at certain construction sites.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a chief privacy officer and policies and protocols relating to the handling of identifying information
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Establishing a chief privacy officer and policies and protocols relating to the handling of identifying information.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to persons not to be detained by the department of probation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Persons not to be detained by the department of probation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring water filtration in schools with water pipes or solder that contain lead
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring water filtration in schools with water pipes or solder that contain lead.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to selective service applications in city jails
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Selective service applications in city jails.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to facilitate the posting of bail or bond
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOC to facilitate the posting of bail or bond.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring information on lactation rooms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring information on lactation rooms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to distribute information regarding educational rights and departmental policies related to interactions with non-local law enforcement
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to distribute information regarding educational rights and departmental policies related to interactions with non-local law enforcement and federal immigration authorities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to expanding the office of immigrant affairs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Expanding the office of immigrant affairs.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the office of long-term planning and sustainability to report on the feasibility of microgrids within the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office of long-term planning and sustainability to report on the feasibility of microgrids within the city of NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to immigration enforcement
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Immigration Enforcement

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to commit to an expeditious transition to an electric bus fleet and to use electric buses as a robust part of its replacement service during the upcoming L train shutdown
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Governor & MTA to commit to an expeditious transition to an electric bus fleet and to use electric buses as a robust part of its replacement service during the upcoming L train shutdown.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting disorderly behavior
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting disorderly behavior.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to diversity programming at senior centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Diversity programming at senior centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reforming the city’s restaurant inspection program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Reforming the city’s restaurant inspection program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that public spaces in buildings include labeled waste and recycling receptacles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring that public spaces in buildings include labeled waste and recycling receptacles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a goal of zero waste for New York city by 2030
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Establishing a goal of zero waste for NYC by 2030.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring usage of full cutoff light fixtures on street lights.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring usage of full cutoff light fixtures on street lights.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to permit arrestees to access contact information.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office of criminal justice or another office or agency designated by the mayor to promote the communication of accurate and complete information regarding posting bail.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend local law number 50 for the year 2015, relating to the preservation of certain hotels, a moratorium and report relating to such preservation, and the expiration and repeal of such amendments, in relation to extending the effective period of the provisions of such local law and requiring a supplemental report relating to such preservation

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to provide curricular and other supports to protect lesbian, gay, bisexual, queer or questioning (LGBQ) and transgender and gender nonconforming (TGNC) and other vulnerable students and to ensure that administrators, teachers and students in all middle and high schools are informed that, under the Equal Access Act, students have a right to convene and participate in a Gender-Sexuality Alliance (GSA) at school.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to provide curricular and other supports to protect lesbian, gay, bisexual, queer or questioning (LGBQ) and transgender and gender nonconforming (TGNC) and other vulnerable students.

Items.MinutesNote: Before the start of this Stated Meeting, a City Council Proclamation was given to Gary Altman, Legislative Counsel to the Speaker's Office, who was retiring after more than 37 years of service to the Council.
